effect.name: TAP Chorus/Flange
effect.description:
TAP Chorus/Flange (LADSPA 2159)
Creates traditional Chorus and Flanger effects, spiced up a bit to make use of stereo processing. It sounds best on guitar and synth tracks.
effect.author: http://www.ladspa.org

parameter.name: Frequency
parameter.comment:
Determines the LFO frequency
with which the time-varying delay is modulated. The higher the frequency, the more intense the effect will be.

parameter.name: L/R Phase Shift
parameter.comment:
Controls the phase shift between the two
LFOs. The higher this setting, the stronger the "stereo-ness" of the effect will be. When set to 0, processing of the two channels will be in-phase; when set to 180 degrees, the two LFO's are is counter-phase to create the widest stereo effect.

parameter.name: Depth
parameter.comment:
Adjusts the modulation depth of the delay.
Increasing it will result in stronger modulation using the same LFO frequency.

parameter.name: Delay
parameter.comment:
Determines the fixed amount of time with
which the signal is delayed after the time-varying delay has been applied. The setting of this control distinguishes between the Chorus and Flanger effects. Delays smaller than 10 ms can be labeled Flanger, delays above 20 ms yield Chorus, and delays in the range of 10-20 ms result in a blend between Chorus and Flanger.

parameter.name: Contour
parameter.comment:
The cutoff frequency of a high-pass
filter applied to the now twice-delayed signal.

parameter.name: Dry Level
parameter.comment:
Allows for a final tuning of the sound.
The strongest effect is achieved if the two settings are about the same. Decreasing one of them (preferably the Wet Level, to mitigate any unwanted side effects) results in a subtler effect.

parameter.name: Wet Level
parameter.comment:
Allows for a final tuning of the sound.
The strongest effect is achieved if the two settings are about the same. Decreasing one of them (preferably the Wet Level, to mitigate any unwanted side effects) results in a subtler effect.
